TextSection.Contents: Lichen planus (LP) is a common inflammatory dermatosis characterized by the development of pruritic violaceous papules or plaques on mucocutaneous surfaces. Eruptions can involve the face neck limbs back genitalia tongue buccal mucosa nails and scalp. LP comprises rare variants affecting the skin and the mucosa. Rare cutaneous LP includes linear LP (referring to blaschkoid and zosteriform distributions of lichenoid lesions) actinic LP annular LP atrophic LP annular atrophic LP lichen planopilaris (comprising Graham Little-Piccardi-Lassueur syndrome and frontal fibrosing alopecia) lichen planus pigmentosus and lichen planus pemphigoides. Rare mucosal LP includes vulvovaginal gingival syndrome and LP sialadenitis.
